budge.ENG: to move, or to make someone or something move

cuddle.ENG: to hold someone or something very close to you with your arms around them, especially to show that you love them

huddle.CHS: 拥挤, 卷缩, 草率从事, 挤作一团

reproach.ENG: to blame or criticize someone in a way that shows you are disappointed at what they have done

escalate.CHS: 逐步升高, 逐步增强

etherize.CHS: <美>[医]以醚麻醉, 化成为醚

disfranchise.CHS: 剥夺公民权, 剥夺推举议员权, 剥夺权利

impregnate.ENG: to make a woman or female animal pregnant

flummox.CHS: 使惶惑, 打乱, 使狼狈, 使混乱
flummox.ENG: If someone is flummoxed by something, they are confused by it and do not know what to do or say

redintegrate.CHS: 使恢复完整, 使更新, 重建
redintegrate.ENG: to make whole or complete again; restore to a perfect state; renew

corroborate.ENG: to provide information that supports or helps to prove someone else’s statement, idea etc

demote.ENG: to make someone’s rank or position lower or less important

interlace.ENG: to join together (patterns, fingers, etc) by crossing, as if woven; intertwine

detoxicate.ENG: to rid (a patient) of a poison or its effects

extricate.CHS: 使解脱, 救出, 使(气体)游离, 放出

intromit.ENG: to enter or insert or allow to enter or be inserted

embroil.CHS: 使卷入, 牵连, 使纠缠
embroil.ENG: to involve someone or something in a difficult situation

insulate.ENG: to cover or protect something with a material that stops electricity, sound, heat etc from getting in or out

nonplus.ENG: to put at a loss; confound

besot.CHS: 使烂醉, 使迷糊, 使沉醉

denude.CHS: 使裸露, 剥下, 剥夺, 脱毛

gratify.ENG: to make someone feel pleased and satisfied

immunize.CHS: 使免疫, 赋予免疫性, 使成为无害
immunize.ENG: to protect someone from a particular illness by giving them a vaccine

confront.ENG: if a problem, difficulty etc confronts you, it appears and needs to be dealt with

obfuscate.ENG: to deliberately make something unclear or difficult to understand

rejuvenate.CHS: 使年轻, 使复原, 使恢复精神, 使恢复活力, 使回春, 使更新

expand.CHS: 使膨胀, 详述, 扩张
expand.ENG: if a company, business etc expands, or if someone expands it, they open new shops, factories etc

implicate.CHS: 使牵连其中, 含意, 暗示

emaciate.ENG: to become or cause to become abnormally thin

straiten.CHS: 使穷困, 使为难, 限制

subjugate.CHS: 使屈服, 征服, 使服从, 克制, 抑制
subjugate.ENG: to defeat a person or group and make them obey you

emulsify.ENG: to combine to become a smooth mixture, or to make two liquids do this

substantiate.ENG: to prove the truth of something that someone has said, claimed etc

debilitate.ENG: to make someone ill and weak

intoxicate.ENG: (of an alcoholic drink) to produce in (a person) a state ranging from euphoria to stupor, usually accompanied by loss of inhibitions and control; make drunk; inebriate

desiccate.CHS: 使完全变干, 干贮(食物等)

invalidate.ENG: to make a document, ticket, claim etc no longer legally or officially acceptable

habituate.CHS: 使习惯于, 使熟习于

stultify.CHS: 使显得愚笨, 使变无效, 使成为徒劳

correlate.ENG: if two or more facts, ideas etc correlate or if you correlate them, they are closely connected to each other or one causes the other

sate.CHS: 使心满意足, 过分的给与
sate.ENG: to satisfy (a desire or appetite) fully

regenerate.CHS: 使新生, 重建, 改革, 革新
regenerate.ENG: to grow again, or make something grow again

irk.ENG: if something irks you, it makes you feel annoyed

ingratiate.ENG: If someone tries to ingratiate themselves with you, they do things to try and make you like them

stun.CHS: 使晕倒, 使惊吓, 打晕

rejoin.CHS: 使再结合, 再加入, 再回答
rejoin.ENG: to say (something) in reply; answer, reply, or retort

fascinate.CHS: 使着迷, 使神魂颠倒

stanch.CHS: 使止血, 止, 止流, 止血

suffocate.CHS: 使窒息, 噎住, 闷熄

insinuate.CHS: 使逐步而巧妙地取得, 使迂回地潜入(或挤入), 使慢慢滋长, 含沙射影地说

emboss.CHS: 饰以浮饰, 使浮雕出来

withdraw.ENG: if you withdraw a threat, offer, request etc, you say that you no longer will do what you said

amass.CHS: 收集, 积聚(尤指财富)

swill.CHS: 涮, 冲洗, 痛饮, 倒出

rive.CHS: 撕开, 劈开, 使沮丧

arraign.CHS: 提问, 传讯, 责难

incarnate.CHS: 体现, 使具体化, 使成化身

modulate.CHS: 调整, 调节, (信号)调制

concoct.CHS: 调制, 调合, 编造

debrief.CHS: 听取报告, 听取汇报

apprise.ENG: to tell or give someone information about something

lambaste.ENG: If you lambaste someone, you criticize them severely, usually in public

execrate.CHS: 痛骂, 憎恨, 憎恶, 诅咒

filch.CHS: 偷窃(不贵重的东西), 窃取
filch.ENG: to steal something small or not very valuable

ejaculate.CHS: 突然说出, (从生物体中)射出
ejaculate.ENG: when a man ejaculates, semen comes out of his penis

obliterate.CHS: 涂去, 删除, 使湮没

detrude.ENG: to force down or thrust away or out

impel.CHS: 推动, 推进, 激励, 驱使, 逼迫

subvert.CHS: 推翻, 暗中破坏, 搅乱

propel.ENG: to move, drive, or push something forward

gulp.CHS: 吞, 一口吞(下), 忍住, 抑制

consign.ENG: to send something somewhere, especially in order to sell it

doff.ENG: to remove the hat you are wearing as a sign of respect

flex.CHS: 弯曲(四肢), 伸缩, 折曲vi折曲, 弯曲
flex.ENG: If you flex your muscles or parts of your body, you bend, move, or stretch them for a short time in order to exercise them

consummate.ENG: to make something complete, especially an agreement

transgress.CHS: 违反, 犯罪, 侵犯

besiege.CHS: 围困, 围攻, 包围

circumvent.CHS: 围绕, 包围, 智取

begird.CHS: 围绕, 缚, 以带子缠绕

safeguard.CHS: 维护, 保护, 捍卫
safeguard.ENG: to protect something from harm or damage

vindicate.CHS: 维护, 辩护, 表白

misconstrue.ENG: to  misunderstand  something that someone has said or done

inhale.ENG: to breathe in air, smoke, or gas

immolate.CHS: 牺牲, 献出, 献祭

excogitate.CHS: 想出, 研究出, 设计, 发明

obviate.CHS: 消除, 排除(危险、障碍等), 回避, 预防, 避免
obviate.ENG: to prevent or avoid a problem or the need to do something

extirpate.CHS: 消灭, 根除, 毁灭, [医]摘除(肿瘤等)

annihilate.ENG: to destroy something or someone completely

indite.CHS: 写(文章,信等)创作, 赋诗, 创作

divulge.ENG: to give someone information that should be secret

discharge.CHS: 卸下, 放出, 清偿(债务), 履行(义务), 解雇, 开(炮), 放(枪), 射(箭)

desecrate.CHS: 亵渎, 污辱, 把(神物)供俗用

emend.ENG: to remove the mistakes from something that has been written

recondition.CHS: 修理, 使复原, 使正常

domesticate.CHS: 驯养, 使安于土地, 教化

compress.ENG: to press something or make it smaller so that it takes up less space, or to become smaller

emasculate.CHS: 阉割, 使柔弱, 删削, 使无力

overwhelm.CHS: 淹没, 覆没, 受打击, 制服, 压倒

retard.CHS: 延迟, 使减速, 阻止, 妨碍, 阻碍

extenuate.CHS: 掩饰, 减轻, 使人原谅, 低估, <古>使稀薄

loathe.ENG: to hate someone or something very much

detest.ENG: to hate something or someone very much

wag.CHS: 摇摆, 摇动, 饶舌
wag.ENG: if a dog wags its tail, or if its tail wags, the dog moves its tail many times from one side to the other

reclaim.CHS: 要求归还, 收回, 开垦

outfox.ENG: If you outfox someone, you defeat them in some way because you are more clever than they are

heckle.CHS: 以麻梳梳理, 激烈质问, 诘问, 集中质问

cajole.CHS: 以甜言蜜语哄骗, 勾引
cajole.ENG: to gradually persuade someone to do something by being nice to them, or making promises to them

restrain.ENG: to stop someone from doing something, often by using physical force

encipher.ENG: to convert (a message, document, etc) from plain text into code or cipher; encode

decipher.ENG: to find the meaning of something that is difficult to read or understand

trigger.CHS: 引发, 引起, 触发

adduce.CHS: 引证, 举出(例证、理由、证据)

ensconce.ENG: to establish or settle firmly or comfortably

secrete.CHS: 隐秘, 隐藏, 隐匿, [生理]分泌

pasteurize.ENG: to subject (milk, beer, etc) to pasteurization

engross.CHS: 用大字体书写, 吸引, 占用, 使全神贯注, 独占

formulate.CHS: 用公式表示, 明确地表达, 作简洁陈述

spellbind.ENG: to cause to be spellbound; entrance or enthral

abduct.ENG: to take someone away by force

wheedle.CHS: 诱骗, 哄骗, 骗得

beguile.ENG: If someone beguiles you into doing something, they trick you into doing it

anticipate.CHS: 预期, 期望, 过早使用, 先人一着, 占先
anticipate.ENG: to expect that something will happen and be ready for it

foreordain.CHS: 预先, 注定, 预定命运

predigest.ENG: to treat (food) artificially to aid subsequent digestion in the body

refurbish.ENG: To refurbish a building or room means to clean it and decorate it and make it more attractive or better equipped

aggrandize.ENG: To aggrandize someone means to make them seem richer, more powerful, and more important than they really are. To aggrandize a building means to make it more impressive.

abhor.ENG: to hate a kind of behaviour or way of thinking, especially because you think it is morally wrong

unfurl.CHS: 展开, 展示, 公开, 使旗招展
unfurl.ENG: if a flag, sail etc unfurls, or if someone unfurls it, it unrolls and opens

convoke.ENG: to tell people that they must come together for a formal meeting

defilade.ENG: to provide protection for by defilade

hoodwink.CHS: 遮眼, 欺骗, 蒙蔽

convulse.CHS: 震动, 震撼, 使抽筋

vanquish.CHS: 征服, 击败, 克服

asseverate.ENG: to assert or declare emphatically or solemnly

sustain.CHS: 支撑, 撑住, 维持, 持续

defray.ENG: to give someone back the money that they have spent on something

enact.CHS: 制定法律, 颁布, 扮演

override.CHS: 制服, 践踏, 奔越过, 蹂躏, 不顾, 不考虑(某人的意见,决定,愿望等)

fabricate.CHS: 制作, 构成, 捏造, 伪造, 虚构

intercept.ENG: If you intercept someone or something that is travelling from one place to another, you stop them before they get to their destination

remodel.CHS: 重新塑造, 改造, 改变
remodel.ENG: to change the shape, structure, or appearance of something, especially a building

eject.CHS: 逐出, 撵出, 驱逐, 喷射
eject.ENG: to make someone leave a place or building by using force

expatriate.CHS: 逐出国外, 脱离国籍, 放逐

ordain.CHS: 注定, 规定, 任命(牧师)
ordain.ENG: to order that something should happen

bless.CHS: 祝福, 保佑, <口>哎呀!我的天哪!
bless.ENG: if God blesses someone or something, he helps and protects them

felicitate.CHS: 祝贺, 庆祝, 庆贺, 把某人看作有福, 庆幸

encapsulate.ENG: to express or show something in a short way

charter.ENG: to pay a company for the use of their aircraft, boat etc

forgo.ENG: to not do or have something pleasant or enjoyable
